issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
Was surprised to hear from Christian that lucene/solr tests take him 40 minutes on a modern mac.

This is too much. Lets look at the slowest tests and make them reasonable.

comments.body:
The list here isn't perfect: I just grepped for [junit4:tophints] and then removed anything under 10 seconds.

{noformat}
[junit4:tophints]  92.15s | org.apache.lucene.search.TestNumericRangeQuery64
[junit4:tophints]  50.26s | org.apache.lucene.index.TestIndexWriterWithThreads
[junit4:tophints]  32.30s | org.apache.lucene.util.packed.TestPackedInts

[junit4:tophints]  15.30s | org.apache.solr.client.solrj.embedded.SolrExampleStreamingTest
[junit4:tophints]  13.11s | org.apache.solr.client.solrj.TestBatchUpdate
[junit4:tophints]  19.05s | org.apache.solr.handler.clustering.DistributedClusteringComponentTest
[junit4:tophints]  12.08s | org.apache.solr.handler.clustering.carrot2.CarrotClusteringEngineTest
[junit4:tophints]  10.00s | org.apache.solr.handler.extraction.ExtractingRequestHandlerTest
[junit4:tophints]  59.16s | org.apache.solr.uima.processor.UIMAUpdateRequestProcessorTest
[junit4:tophints]  50.77s | org.apache.solr.uima.analysis.UIMATypeAwareAnnotationsTokenizerFactoryTest
[junit4:tophints]  50.67s | org.apache.solr.uima.analysis.UIMAAnnotationsTokenizerFactoryTest
{noformat}

Thanks, Robert.

It might just be that my system is odd. :)  It would be great to hear what others get on their Mac systems.  Mine is a 2010 MacBook Pro with a Core i7 CPU, 8GB RAM and an 512GB SSD (a rather full one) running Mac OS X Lion.

author.name: dweiss
author.emailAddress: dawid dot weiss at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Can you check the execution stats from your system, Christian? We'll see how odd your system is:
{code}
ant clean
for i in `seq 1 20`; do 
  ant -Dtests.cachefile=/somewhere/outside/workspace/testtimes.log test
done
{code}

The "testtimes.log" will contain execution time for all suites, you could compare these to the cached one (lucene/tools/junit4/cached-timehints.txt) in the checkout. Absolute values will differ but the ordering and relative scale should remain pretty much the same. I think?

updateAuthor.name: dweiss
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dawid dot weiss at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Thanks a lot, Dawid.  I'll try this, have a look and report back.

Adrien, thanks for taking the time!

I have a similar MacBook to Christian (OSX Lion, Mid 2010, Core i7, 8GB RAM, 480GB SSD, ~90% full) and running "ant test" takes 20-25 minutes to execute. I have not run the stats that Dawid posted previously, those times are just what I have seen in the past few months.

author.name: dweiss
author.emailAddress: dawid dot weiss at gmail dot com

comments.body: It may be the I/O overhead... those tests are generating lots of files, maybe with a nearly full disk things slow down a lot (?).

updateAuthor.name: dweiss
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dawid dot weiss at gmail dot com
